description: Excavation of a single storey basement extension with a front lightwell, erection of a single storey side extension (with alterations to the attached existing single storey rear and rear infill extension) and rear roof dormer extension and installation of one replacement front and three replacement rear roof lights and replacement first floor rear double doors/ windows to the house.
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall begin not later than three years from the date of this decision.

Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and specifications:  022 (Rev D), 023 (Rev D) Received:  02 April 2024,  020 (Rev A); 021 (Rev B) Received:  18 March 2024,  001, 002, 003, 004, 005
Received:  10 November 2023.  

Reason: In order to ensure the development is carried out in accordance with the planning permission.

Condition : 3 - The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the development hereby permitted shall match those used in the existing building, unless otherwise shown on the approved plans.

Reason: In order to safeguard the appearance of the area.

Condition : 4 - No additional windows, doors or other glazed openings shall be formed in the house's single storey rear and rear infill extension, single storey side extension and rear roof dormer extension hereby approved.  

Reasons:  To protect the character and appearance of the Conservation Area and neighbour living conditions in accordance with Local Plan Policies SC7 (Residential extensions and alterations), CC1 (Context and character) and CC2 (Urban design and architecture) and the Residential Extension Guidelines.

Condition : 5 - The single storey basement extension hereby approved shall be built in line with flood prevention and management measures proposed in the submitted and hereby approved Flood Risk Assessment.  

Reason:  To protect occupiers from flooding risk in accordance with Local Plan Policy EQ3 (Flood Risk and Surface Water Management).

Condition : 6 - During works, an appropriate wheel-washing system shall be operated to remove mud, stones and other extraneous materials from vehicle wheels and chassis' leaving the site, and all departing loads shall be fully covered to ensure no material is deposited on the highway. The exit from the wheel wash shall be a hard, non-porous surface sited as far away from the exit as is possible given the site constraints and kept clean at all times.  
Waste water discharged from the wheel wash shall be stored and disposed of on site and not discharged into the public sewer unless soil, stones and any suspended material have first been removed.  

The developer shall ensure that no dust or other debris is carried on to adjoining properties in accordance with the guidance at https://www.london.gov.uk/file/18750/download?token=zV3ZKTpP. 
Site lighting shall be designed, positioned and directed so as not to unnecessarily intrude on passing drivers or direct light into any neighbouring windows in accordance with the guidance provided by the Institute of Lighting Engineers Guidance Note: For The Reduction Of Obtrusive Light 2021.  

All vehicle arrivals and departures shall be supervised and the condition of the highway examined immediately afterwards.  Any materials shed from the vehicle during such movement shall be immediately removed from the highway, and returned to site or carted away for disposal and shall not be washed into the surface water drainage system.

Reasons:  To protect neighbours' living conditions and in the interests of highway safety in accordance with Local Plan Policies EQ4 (Air Quality), EQ5 (Noise) and EC2 (Developing a Sustainable Local Transport Network).  

Notes:

For the wheel washing system above, the preferred distance between it and the exit to the highway is 100 metres if this is practicable.

Condition : 7 - No development shall be carried out until such time as the person carrying out the work is a member of the Considerate Constructors Scheme and its code of practice, and the details of the membership and contact details are clearly displayed on the site so that they can be easily read by members of the public. 

Reason: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring residents in accordance with Local Plan Policies EQ4 (Air Quality), EQ5 (Noise) and EC2 (Developing a Sustainable Local Transport Network).
